question: The price of 1 kg apples, which was $5 last month, is $6 today. The demand curve for apples must have shifted rightward between last month and today. State True or False
The individual’s demand curve for a commodity represents

answers.a: a maximum boundary of the individual’s intentions
answers.b: a minimum boundary of the individual’s intentions
answers.c: both a maximum and a minimum boundary of the individual’s intentions
answers.d: neither a maximum nor a minimum boundary of the individual’s intentions

question: When an individual’s income rises (while everything else remains the same), that person’s demand for a normal good
When an individual’s income falls (while everything else remains the same), that person’s demand for an inferior good

answers.d: we cannot say without additional information

question: When the price of a substitute of commodity X falls, the demand for X
When both the price of a substitute and the price of a complement of commodity X rise, the demand for X

answers.d: all of the above are possible
